intro: Galium sylvestre var. rosellum, commonly known as rose campion, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are pink or white, arranged in clusters, and bloom from late spring to early summer. It is characterized by its delicate appearance and is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia.
